title: Factors affecting price elasticity of demand

content.prompt: Which of the following combinations is most likely to result in the demand for a product being highly price inelastic?

choices.label: The product has few close substitutes and represents a small percentage of a consumer’s income.
The product has few close substitutes and represents a large percentage of a consumer’s income.
The product has many close substitutes and represents a small percentage of a consumer’s income.
The product has many close substitutes and represents a moderate percentage of a consumer’s income.
The product has many close substitutes and represents a large percentage of a consumer’s income.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
